how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Other
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does:
I use TW as my primary knowledge base and to keep track what is to be done.
I know that I won't loose any information as soon as I put it into a tiddler.
I also use TW as a single point of entry to link to the corporate tools.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles;I have written custom JavaScript
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)
how do you back up/sync changes between: N/A - I keep my wiki on a single system

outside of plugins, palettes and other i:
Stylesheets, macros to customize rendering of information or to link to corporate tools, a bit of javascript to automate some calculations.
Some of this customisations come from the community.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
TW is a reliable piece of software.
The community is friendly and responsive and provides a lot of resources.
Thanks a lot for the great work !
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
TW seems a bit overwhelming for newcomers, so maybe trying to lower the entry barrier.
All in all, I am not afraid in the future of TW.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
